meanings.definition: An intense but short-lived passion or admiration for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her infatuation with the movie star lasted only a week.
meanings.sent2: His infatuation with his new hobby was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's infatuation with unicorns made her room a magical wonderland.
meanings.sent4: The infatuation with fame can sometimes lead to disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The infatuation with the idea of love blinded her to reality.

meanings.sent1: The infatuation she felt for him was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: Their infatuation was obvious to all who knew them.
meanings.sent3: The infatuation with chocolate was strong in the room.
meanings.sent4: The infatuation with power can corrupt even the noblest of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The infatuation with success drove him to work harder than ever before.
